connectorCategory.name: SEI Components
connectorCategory.description: Components provided by the Software Engineering Institute

connectorDescriptor.name: FACE Data Model to AADL Translator
Cheddar Plugin
connectorDescriptor.description: Cheddar is a real-time scheduling analysis tool composed of a scheduling simulator and a set of schedulability tests.

overview.summary:
Cheddar is a real-time scheduling analysis tool composed of a scheduling simulator and a set of schedulability tests.
This plugin allows to generate Cheddar models to verify schedulability of uniprocessor and multiprocessor real-time systems.

connectorDescriptor.name: BLESS Editor and Proof Assistant
connectorDescriptor.description: The Behavior Language for Embedded Systems with Software (BLESS) is an annex sublanguage of AADL to express behavior of components with state-transition machines.

overview.summary:
The Behavior Language for Embedded Systems with Software (BLESS) is an annex sublanguage of AADL to express behavior of components with state-transition machines. BLESS is a superset of BA adding non-executed assertions expressing what is true about the system when in a state, or a point during execution of an action during transition.
The goal of the BLESS language and tools is to enable the construction of proofs for AADL models that their (operational) behavior upholds their (declarative) specification. Therefore all specifications, programs, and executions be precise, mathematical objects, about which propositions can be made, and proven correct. Correctness of containing components can be proved from proved-correct subcomponents and their connections.
Code generation from BLESS state machines to both Slang and ISOSCELES tool chains produces executables.
Providers: The BLESS editors and translators are provided under a Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 international license.
The BLESS Proof Assistant which generates verification conditions and transforms them into deductive proofs is provided by Multitude Corporation under a simple End User License Agreement.
Icon made by Freepik from www.flaticon.com; licensed under CC BY 3.0

connectorDescriptor.description: The Architecture Supported Audit Processor (ASAP) provides safety-specific views of a system.
connectorDescriptor.name: ASAP (Safety Views)

overview.summary: The Architecture-Supported Audit Processor (ASAP) is a plugin to OSATE that presents safety-specific representations of a system. Background and explanation can be found in the publication "Architecture-Supported Audit Processor: Interactive, Query-Driven Assurance" (currently unpublished, contact the maintainer for a preprint).

connectorDescriptor.name: RAMSES-2
connectorDescriptor.description: RAMSES (Refinement of AADL Models for Synthesis of Embedded Systems) compiles AADL models into code for ARINC653, POSIX, and OSEK compliant operating systems.

overview.summary: RAMSES (Refinement of AADL Models for Synthesis of Embedded Systems) is a model transformation and code generation tool that produces C source code for POSIX, ARINC653, or OSEK compliant operating systems. RAMSES is a plugin of OSATE2 that proceeds by refinement : it produces refined AADL models as intermediate steps towards code generation. This refined model includes a behavior annex subclause that expresses the behavior resulting from the expansion of AADL components, connections, and behavior. It is then transformed into C source code, as well as Makefiles guiding the target platform compiler towards the production of an executable code.
